title: Specter Protocol Unleashed
outcome: In the wake of the archive’s release and public investigations, a series of mass memory lapses spread among returned 'ghost users.' Oksana and Rada discover Halden’s last fail-safe—Specter Protocol—begun during the first BCI pilot. It auto-erases dangerous memories when governance is threatened. Testimonies, evidence, and even key panel members’ recollections are corrupted, throwing the citizen inquiry into chaos and fueling fears of irreversible erasure. In their urgency, the population demands a reckoning with the very origins of algorithmic rule, and the Council is forced to confront the full ethical horror of its creation.

events.description: Hundreds of citizens, mainly former 'ghost users,' report sudden memory lapses. Key testimonies from returning citizens are corrupted, causing confusion at review panels.
Rada and Oksana discover evidence of a legacy 'Specter Protocol' designed to erase high-risk systemic memories if the BCI’s authority fails, confirming Halden’s involvement.
Mass protests erupt as more vital testimony disappears. Citizens fear that decades of hidden abuses may never surface, and panels struggle to maintain trust.
Council factions argue about revealing the Specter Protocol. Harmonists want transparency, Directorate pushes to discredit all affected memories, and Innovators scramble for a technical fix.

Faced with irreversible memory loss and mounting unrest, all sides are forced to confront the ethical line crossed by Halden and early BCI architects, sparking demands for wholly new systems of governance.
